Package movement

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • movement.Touple
      • movement.Move
  • public class Move
extends Touple
    A move is a set of relative coordinates, to which a piece may move.
    Author:
    Alexander

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Move​(int x, int y)
      A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
      Move​(int x, int y, int maxMove)
      A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
      Move​(int x, int y, int maxMove, int minMove)
      A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
      Move​(int x, int y, int maxMove, int minMove, boolean chains)
      A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
      Move​(int x, int y, MoveHistory effect)
      A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void activate()
      Sets the "active" state of this piece to true, making is conditionally able to be used.
      boolean chains()
      Returns if this move can allow its piece to immediately take another move.
      void deactivate()
      Sets the "active" state of this piece as false, making it not able to be used.
      MoveHistory getEffect()
      Gives the secondary effect as a MoveHistory.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get the name of the piece as a string.
      boolean hasEffect()
      Determines whether or not this move has a secondary effect.
      boolean isActive​(int moveNumber)
      Returns if this is an active move based on how many times the piece has moved and its "active" state.
      void setName​(java.lang.String newName)
      Changes the name of this piece.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move​(int x,
            int y)
        A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
        Parameters:
        x - How many squares in the x-direction to move.
        y - How many squares in the y-direction to move.

      • Move

        public Move​(int x,
            int y,
            MoveHistory effect)
        A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
        Parameters:
        x - How many squares in the x-direction to move.
        y - How many squares in the y-direction to move.
        effect - Another move (usually on another piece) that this move will cause if it is activated.

      • Move

        public Move​(int x,
            int y,
            int maxMove)
        A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
        Parameters:
        x - How many squares in the x-direction to move.
        y - How many squares in the y-direction to move.
        maxMove - The maximum times this piece can move before this move is no longer allowed.

      • Move

        public Move​(int x,
            int y,
            int maxMove,
            int minMove)
        A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
        Parameters:
        x - How many squares in the x-direction to move.
        y - How many squares in the y-direction to move.
        maxMove - The maximum times this piece can move before this move is no longer allowed.
        minMove - The minimum times this piece can move before this move is first allowed.

      • Move

        public Move​(int x,
            int y,
            int maxMove,
            int minMove,
            boolean chains)
        A move with an x and y coordinate, relative to the piece which wants to move.
        Parameters:
        x - How many squares in the x-direction to move.
        y - How many squares in the y-direction to move.
        maxMove - The maximum times this piece can move before this move is no longer allowed.
        minMove - The minimum times this piece can move before this move is first allowed.
        chains - Whether this move can allow its piece to move again on the same turn.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the piece as a string.
        Returns:
        The unlocalized name of this piece.

      • setName

        public void setName​(java.lang.String newName)
        Changes the name of this piece.
        Parameters:
        newName - The string to change the unlocalized name to.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive​(int moveNumber)
        Returns if this is an active move based on how many times the piece has moved and its "active" state.
        Parameters:
        moveNumber - The move # that the parent piece is on.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this move is available to be used.

      • activate

        public void activate()
        Sets the "active" state of this piece to true, making is conditionally able to be used.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Sets the "active" state of this piece as false, making it not able to be used.

      • chains

        public boolean chains()
        Returns if this move can allow its piece to immediately take another move.
        Returns:
        True if this move can be chained, false if it cannot.

      • hasEffect

        public boolean hasEffect()
        Determines whether or not this move has a secondary effect.
        Returns:
        true if it has an effect, false if it does not.

      • getEffect

        public MoveHistory getEffect()
        Gives the secondary effect as a MoveHistory.
        Returns:
        The effect to be used to effect another piece.
